alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Bullock; Elmore; Lee; Lowndes; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:12AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Autauga, southern Elmore, western Lee, northwestern Bullock, northeastern Lowndes, Macon, southeastern Tallapoosa and Montgomery Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Still Waters Resort to Emerald Mountain to Autaugaville. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Auburn, Prattville, Opelika, Millbrook, Tuskegee, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Notasulga, Milstead, Pike Road, Elmore, Coosada, Eclectic, Autaugaville, Shorter, Franklin, Martin Dam, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama and Auburn University In Montgomery. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Autauga; Bullock; Elmore; Lee; Lowndes; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa
